usefulItems: toothpick, icing bag and tip, icing spatula, cupcake liners, 12 hole muffin pans, oven
title: Spider Web Cupcakes

ingredients.content: 2 ½ oz unsalted butter, room temperature
1 egg white, from a large egg
1 ½ tsp gel food coloring, black (optional)

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line 2 muffin pans with cupcake liners and set aside.
Place sugar, butter, peanut butter, eggs and vanilla paste into mixing bowl and mix <b>15 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add flour, baking powder, salt and milk and mix <b>20 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, add chocolate chips and mix <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>.
Fill cupcake liners ½ full and bake for 18-20 minutes (350°F) or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean. Allow to cool completely before frosting. Meanwhile, clean mixing bowl and make icing.
Place sugar into mixing bowl and grind <b>20 sec/speed 10<b>.
Add egg white and lemon juice and mix <b>10 sec/speed 6<b>. Transfer to an icing bag and set aside.

<b>Insert butterfly whisk<b>. Place butter into mixing bowl and mix <b>20 sec/speed 3<b>. Add confectioners sugar, cocoa powder, whipping cream, vanilla and black food coloring gel and mix <b>3 min/speed 4<b>. <b>Remove butterfly whisk.<b>

Apply black frosting with an icing spatula. Pipe white Royal Icing onto top of frosted cupcakes in a spiral. Using a toothpick, drag through white frosting from the center outwards, creating a spider web. Serve immediately or store loosely covered.

hintsAndTricks: Perfect for Halloween and a fun and easy activity to do with kids.

To make vanilla bean paste: place 6-10 whole vanilla bean pods into mixing bowl and grind <b>20 sec/speed 10<b> or until pulverized. Add 3 tbsp pure vanilla extract and 2 tsp xanthan gum (optional) and stir <b>3 sec/speed 3<b>. Transfer to a glass jar and use as required.
Vanilla bean paste can be replaced with vanilla extract.
Purchase plastic spider rings and place one on each cupcake.
